meanings.sent1: She trapans her friends by pretending to be sick when she doesn't want to go out.
meanings.sent2: The magician trapans the audience with his clever illusions.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat trapans the dog by hiding its favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: His smooth words trapans people into believing his lies.
meanings.sent5: The cunning fox trapans the other animals to steal their food.

meanings.definition: Deceptive or cunning actions or schemes
meanings.sent1: The trapans of the con artist fooled many unsuspecting victims.
meanings.sent2: She saw through his trapans and refused to be swindled.
meanings.sent3: The trapans of the clever raccoon outsmarted the campers trying to protect their food.
meanings.sent4: The trapans of the spy were so intricate that no one suspected a thing.
meanings.sent5: The trapans of the villain were finally exposed, revealing his true intentions.
